CatDescriptText: Curtis Irvin, city worker, 1241 Liverpool Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 4, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that theatrical productions like 'The Green Pastures,' which 'take-off' on religions, should be presented as entertainment?" answer reads: "I would like to see more programs like 'Green Pastures,' if the producers took out the clowning and made it more serious. Such programs containing a religious message reach a lot of people who do not go to church or only go to church now and then."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Curtis Irvin wearing moustache, dark jacket with light colored trim and buttons, cap, and striped shirt, standing in front of brick building with graffiti
